text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Vivi a trust and safety
manager here at the AWS office in Cape
Town South Africa
today I'm going to show you how to
delete or terminate your Amazon elastic
compute Cloud instance from your AWS
account let's get started
first log in to the AWS Management
console using your credentials
after you log in use the search bar to
navigate to the ec2 dashboard
from the top right corner of the page
select the region where your ec2
instance is running
under resources choose instances running
to see the list of your ec2 instances
select the instance that you want to
terminate by choosing the checkbox next
to it
choose the instant State button at the
top right of the page then from the drop
down list select terminate instance
you'll receive a confirmation pop-up
after you read the information on the
confirmation pop-up choose terminate to
confirm the termination process doing so
terminates your instance and all the
associated data with it
note that terminating an easy to
instance permanently deletes all the
data associated with it so make sure
that you have backed up any important
Data before proceeding with termination
and now you know how to delete or
terminate your Amazon elastic compute
Cloud instance from your AWS account
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
